briefdescription.para: Maximum number of frames in index, should be in sync with above.
Shift count for senone scores.
Large "bad" score.

detaileddescription.para: This number must be "bad" enough so that 4 times WORST_SCORE will not overflow. The reason for this is that the search doesn't check the scores in a model before evaluating the model and it may require as many was 4 plies before the new 'good' score can wipe out the initial WORST_SCORE initialization.

briefdescription.para: Watch out, though! Transition matrix entries that are supposed to be "zero" don't actually get that small due to quantization.
Is one score better than another?
Is one score worse than another?
Hard-coded limit on the number of emitting states.
Access macros.
Change the senone score array for a context.
Type for frame index values.

detaileddescription.para: Used in HMM indexes and backpointers and affects memory required. Make it int32 to be able to process longer utterances. Due to limitations of FSG search implementation this value needs to be signed.

briefdescription.para: Create an HMM context.
Free an HMM context.

simplesect.para: The transition matrices, senone scores, and senone sequence mapping are all assumed to be allocated externally, and will NOT be freed by this function.

memberdef.argsstring: (hmm_context_t *ctx, hmm_t *hmm, int mpx, int ssid, int tmatid)
memberdef.name: hmm_init

briefdescription.para: Populate a previously-allocated HMM structure, allocating internal data.
Free an HMM structure, releasing internal data (but not the HMM structure itself).
Reset the states of the HMM to the invalid condition.

detaileddescription.para: i.e., scores to WORST_SCORE and hist to undefined.

briefdescription.para: Reset the scores of the HMM.
Renormalize the scores in this HMM based on the given best score.

memberdef.argsstring: (hmm_t *h, int32 score, int32 histid, int frame)
memberdef.name: hmm_enter

briefdescription.para: Enter an HMM with the given path score and history ID.
Viterbi evaluation of given HMM.

simplesect.para: If this module were being used for tracking state segmentations, the dummy, non-emitting exit state would have to be updated separately. In the Viterbi DP diagram, transitions to the exit state occur from the current time; they are vertical transitions. Hence they should be made only after the history has been logged for the emitting states. But we're not bothered with state segmentations, for now. So, we update the exit state as well.

briefdescription.para: In/Out: HMM being updated
An output file pointer
Like hmm_vit_eval, but dump HMM state and relevant senscr to fp first, for debugging;.
In/Out: HMM being updated
An output file pointer
For debugging, dump the whole HMM out.
Implementation of HMM base structure.

detaileddescription.para: For efficiency, this version is hardwired for two possible HMM topologies, but will fall back to others:
5-state left-to-right HMMs: (0 is the emitting entry state and E is a non-emitting exit state; the x's indicate allowed transitions between source and destination states):

para.preformatted: 0 1 2 3 4 E (destination-states) 0 x x x 1 x x x 2 x x x 3 x x x 4 x x (source-states)

detaileddescription.para: 5-state topologies that contain a subset of the above transitions should work as well.
3-state left-to-right HMMs (similar notation as the 5-state topology above):

para.preformatted: 0 1 2 E (destination-states) 0 x x x 1 x x x 2 x x (source-states)

detaileddescription.para: 3-state topologies that contain a subset of the above transitions should work as well.
